alert.note: Alert for Dickens (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 11:46PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Central and northern portions of Dickens County. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1141 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall from earlier thunderstorms has ended. However, minor flooding is likely ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Although rain has ended, slow drainage will result in the continuation of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dickens, Afton and Mcadoo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
